verses.kjv: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.
verses.ct: Early on Sunday morning, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb and discovered that the stone had been moved away from the entrance.

verses.kjv: Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the LORD out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.
verses.ct: She ran to find Simon Peter and the other disciple — the one Jesus loved — and told them, "They've removed the Lord from the tomb, and we don't know where they've put him!"

verses.kjv: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.
verses.ct: So Peter and the other disciple headed out toward the tomb.

verses.kjv: So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.
verses.ct: They both started running, but the other disciple was faster than Peter and reached the tomb first.

verses.kjv: And he stooping down, and looking in, saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.
verses.ct: He bent down and peered inside, where he could see the linen burial wrappings lying there, but he didn't go in.

verses.kjv: Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,
verses.ct: Then Simon Peter arrived right behind him and went straight into the tomb. He also saw the linen wrappings lying there,

verses.kjv: And the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.
verses.ct: and the cloth that had covered Jesus' head was folded up neatly and placed separately from the other wrappings.

verses.kjv: Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.
verses.ct: Then the other disciple, the one who had arrived first, also went inside. He saw all of this and believed.

verses.kjv: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.
verses.ct: Up to that point, they still hadn't understood the Scripture saying that he had to rise from the dead.

verses.kjv: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.
verses.ct: After that, the 2 disciples returned home.

verses.kjv: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down, and looked into the sepulchre,
verses.ct: But Mary stayed outside the tomb, crying. As she wept, she bent down and looked inside the tomb.

verses.kjv: And seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
verses.ct: She saw 2 angels dressed in white, sitting where Jesus' body had been — one at the head and one at the feet.

verses.kjv: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my LORD, and I know not where they have laid him.
verses.ct: They asked her, "Why are you crying?" She answered, "Someone has taken my Lord away, and I don't know where they've put him."

verses.kjv: And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.
verses.ct: After saying this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she didn't recognize him.

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.
verses.ct: Jesus asked her, "Why are you crying? Who are you looking for?" Thinking he was the gardener, she said, "Sir, if you carried him away, please tell me where you put him, and I'll go get him."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.
verses.ct: Jesus simply said, "Mary." She turned toward him and exclaimed, "Rabboni!" — which means "Teacher."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father; and to my God, and your God.
verses.ct: Jesus told her, "Don't hold on to me, because I haven't gone up to my Father yet. Instead, go to my brothers and tell them: I am going up to my Father and your Father — to my God and your God."

verses.kjv: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the LORD, and that he had spoken these things unto her.
verses.ct: Mary Magdalene went to the disciples and announced, "I've seen the Lord!" Then she shared everything he had said to her.

verses.kjv: Then the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
verses.ct: That evening, on that same Sunday, the disciples had gathered together with the doors locked because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus appeared and stood right in the middle of them and said, "Peace to you."

verses.kjv: And when he had so said, he shewed unto them his hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the LORD.
verses.ct: After he said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
verses.ct: Jesus spoke to them again: "Peace to you. Just as my Father has sent me, I am now sending you."

verses.kjv: And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:
verses.ct: Then he breathed on them and said, "Receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.
verses.ct: If you forgive anyone's sins, they are forgiven. If you don't forgive them, they remain unforgiven."

verses.kjv: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
verses.ct: Now Thomas, one of the 12 — also known as Didymus — wasn't with them when Jesus came.

verses.kjv: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the LORD. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.
verses.ct: So the other disciples told him, "We've seen the Lord!" But he replied, "Unless I see the nail marks in his hands, put my finger where the nails were, and place my hand into his side, I absolutely will not believe it."

verses.kjv: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them: then came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.
verses.ct: 8 days later, the disciples were together indoors again, and this time Thomas was with them. Even though the doors were locked, Jesus appeared and stood among them and said, "Peace to you."

verses.kjv: Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and thrust it into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.
verses.ct: Then he said to Thomas, "Put your finger here and look at my hands. Reach out your hand and place it in my side. Stop doubting and believe."

verses.kjv: And Thomas answered and said unto him, My LORD and my God.
verses.ct: Thomas responded, "My Lord and my God!"

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "You believe because you've seen me. How blessed are those who believe without ever seeing."

verses.kjv: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:
verses.ct: Jesus performed many other miraculous signs in front of his disciples that aren't recorded in this book.

verses.kjv: But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.
verses.ct: But these have been written so that you would believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you would have life through his name.
